title: Determine Thermal Vegetation Periods
text: vegetation period, growing season, period year weather conditions sufficient plants grow. package provides methods calculate climatological thermal growing seasons solely based daily mean temperatures day year (DOY). simplicity, commonly used plant growth models climate change impact assessments. concept temperature driven vegetation period holds mostly temperate climate zone. lower latitudes, factors precipitation evaporation can decisive. methods GSL ETCCDI employed globally (half year shift southern hemisphere). Others smaller area application parameterized local regional observations. However, methods Menzel vonWilpert used throughout Germany. package also includes functions downloading open meteo data Germany’s National Meteorological Service (Deutscher Wetterdienst, DWD).

title: Vegetation Start and End Method
text: first span least 6 consecutive days daily mean temperature TG > 5°C
code: # mark days warmer than 5°C df$period <- ifelse(df$Tavg > Tmin, 1, 0)  # find first six day span per year start <- tapply(df$period, df$year, FUN=function(x){   sixer <- as.numeric(stats::filter(x, rep(1, 6), sides=1))   doy <- which(!is.na(sixer) & sixer == 6)   ifelse(length(doy) == 0, NA, min(doy)) })

title: Vegetation Start and End Method
text: first span July 1st 6 consecutive days TG < 5°C.
code: # 1. July is DOY 182 and DOY 183 in leap years years <- unique(df$year) leap_year <- ifelse((years%%4==0 & years%%100!=0) | years%%400==0, TRUE, FALSE) jul1 <- ifelse(leap_year, 183L, 182L)  # mark days colder than 5°C df$period <- ifelse(df$Tavg < Tmin, 1, 0)  # find first six day span per year end <- ifelse(leap_year, 366L, 365L) for(i in seq_along(years)){   temp <- df[df$year == years[i] & df$DOY > jul1[i], ]   temp$six <-  as.numeric(stats::filter(temp$period, rep(1, 6), sides=1))   possible.end <- temp[!is.na(temp$six) & temp$six == 6, "DOY"]   if(length(possible.end) > 0)     end[i] <- min(possible.end) }

title: Vegetation Start Method
code: - counting chill days in Nov & Dec of previous year if previous year available else estimate previous year's chill days  - count chill days in current year  - determine critical temperature per days using regression equation fitted by Menzel 1997  - calculate HeatSum starting from Feb  - vegetation start if HeatSum >= criticalTemp

title: Determine vegetation period — vegperiod
code: vegperiod(   dates,   Tavg,   start.method,   end.method,   Tsum.out = FALSE,   Tsum.crit = 0,   species = NULL,   est.prev = 0,   check.data = TRUE )

title: Determine vegetation period — vegperiod
text: dates vector calendar dates (objects class Date something understood .Date()). Must contain entire years est.prev > 0 else first year may comprise November December. Tavg vector daily average air temperatures degree Celsius. length dates. start.method name method use vegetation start. One "Menzel" (needs additional argument species, see ), "StdMeteo" resp. "ETCCDI", "Ribes uva-crispa". Can abbreviated (partial matching). discussion see Details. end.method name method use vegetation end. One "vonWilpert", "LWF-BROOK90", "NuskeAlbert" "StdMeteo" resp. "ETCCDI". Can abbreviated (partial matching). discussion see Details. Tsum.boolean. Return sum daily mean temperatures Tsum.crit within vegetation period, also known growing day degrees. Tsum.crit threshold sum day degrees. daily mean temperatures > Tsum.crit tallied. default 0 prevents negative daily temperatures reducing sum. Climate change studies often use threshold 5. species name tree species (required start.method="Menzel" ignored otherwise). Must one "Larix decidua", "Picea abies (frueh)", "Picea abies (spaet)", "Picea abies (noerdl.)", "Picea omorika", "Pinus sylvestris", "Betula pubescens", "Quercus robur", "Quercus petraea", "Fagus sylvatica". est.prev number years estimate previous year's chill days first year (required start.method="Menzel" ignored otherwise). Menzel requires number chill days previous November December. est.prev = 0 first year used get previous year's chill days dropped afterwards. Thus, year time series lost. avoid losing year, est.prev = n estimates previous year's chill days first year average n first years time series. check.data Performs plausibility checks temperature data ensure temperatures multiplied ten. Plausible range -35 +40°C.
